text: Crosby is a coastal town in the Metropolitan Borough of Sefton. It used to be in Lancashire. It is about 6 miles (9.6 km) north of Liverpool. It grew because of the Liverpool, Crosby and Southport Railway which opened in 1848. At the 2001 UK census, Crosby had a population of 51,789. On Crosby beach is Antony Gormley's art installation Another Place. == References == Category:Towns in Merseyside Category:Metropolitan Borough of Sefton
title: Crosby, Merseyside
